See the definitions of &#8220;large accelerated filer,&#8221; &#8220;accelerated filer,&#8221; &#8220;smaller reporting company,&#8221; and &#8220;emerging growth company&#8221; in Rule 12b-2 of the Exchange Act.</p>

<tr>
<td valign="bottom" style="width:9%;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:1.5pt;;text-indent:0pt;;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>

<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#CFF0FC;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:1%;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:9.5pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:67.3%;">

<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:1.48%;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:9.5pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:1pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>

</table></div>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The accompanying notes are an integral part of these financial statements</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">5</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" />
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:9pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><a href="#FOR_QUARTER_ENDED_MARCH_31_2019"><span style="text-decoration:underline;">Table of Contents</span></a></p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:9pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;" id="FIS_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT">OSHKOSH CORPORATION</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">NOTES TO CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">(Unaudited)</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000278" name="us-gaap:OrganizationConsolidationAndPresentationOfFinancialStatementsDisclosureTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191001_20191231" escape="true">
<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">1.</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:bold;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Calibri;font-size:10pt;">Basis of Presentation</p></td></tr></table></div>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">In the opinion of management, the accompanying unaudited Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements contain all adjustments (which include normal recurring adjustments, unless otherwise noted) necessary to present fairly the financial position, results of operations and cash flows for the periods presented. Certain information and footnote disclosures normally included in financial statements prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles in the United States (U.S. GAAP) have been condensed or omitted pursuant to the rules and regulations of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission. These Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements should be read in conjunction with the audited financial statements and notes thereto included in the Annual Report on Form&#160;10-K of Oshkosh Corporation for the year ended September&#160;30,&#160;2019. The interim results are not necessarily indicative of results for the full year. &#8220;Oshkosh&#8221; refers to Oshkosh Corporation not including its subsidiaries and &#8220;the Company&#8221; refers to Oshkosh Corporation and its subsidiaries. </p></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000279" name="us-gaap:NewAccountingPronouncementsAndChangesInAccountingPrinciplesTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191001_20191231" escape="true" continuedAt="F_000279_dcnt_e50af5b2-b9ae-4b96-915a-8e227896390b">
<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">2.</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:bold;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Calibri;font-size:10pt;"><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000298" name="us-gaap:NewAccountingPronouncementsPolicyPolicyTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191001_20191231" escape="true" continuedAt="F_000298_cnt_1">New Accounting Standards</ix:nonNumeric></p></td></tr></table></div><ix:continuation id="F_000298_cnt_1" continuedAt="F_000298_dcnt_69f36a5e-f987-4984-a023-5a243abd1ed3">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">In February 2016, the Financial Accounting Standards Board (FASB) issued ASU 2016-02, <span style="font-style:italic;">Leases (Topic 842)</span>, which requires lessees to reflect most leases on their balance sheet as lease liabilities with corresponding right-of-use (&#8220;ROU&#8221;) assets, while leaving presentation of lease expense in the statement of income largely unchanged. ROU assets represent the Company&#8217;s right to use an underlying asset during the lease term and lease liabilities represent the Company&#8217;s obligation to make lease payments arising from the lease. The Company adopted the new guidance on October&#160;1, 2019 following the modified retrospective method of transition. Prior period comparative information was not recast to reflect the impact of the new guidance and therefore continues to be reported under the accounting guidance in effect during those periods <span style="font-style:italic;">(Accounting Standards Codification (ASC) 840)</span>.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The new standard provided a number of optional practical expedients for transition. The Company elected to adopt the standard using the package of practical expedients, which allowed the Company not to reassess prior conclusions about lease identification, lease classification and initial direct costs. In addition, the new guidance provides practical expedients for an entity&#8217;s ongoing lessee accounting. The Company has elected not to separate payments for lease components from payments for non-lease components for any classes of assets. The Company has elected the short-term lease recognition exemption for all leases that qualify, which means ROU assets and lease liabilities will not be recognized for leases with an initial term of twelve months or less.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The most significant quantitative effect of adoption relates to the recognition of ROU assets and lease liabilities on the balance sheet for operating leases. The adoption did not have a material impact on the Company&#8217;s results of operations or cash flows.</p></ix:continuation></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">6</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" />
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:9pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><a href="#FOR_QUARTER_ENDED_MARCH_31_2019"><span style="text-decoration:underline;">Table of Contents</span></a></p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">OSHKOSH CORPORATION</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">NOTES TO CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">(Unaudited)</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p><ix:continuation id="F_000279_dcnt_e50af5b2-b9ae-4b96-915a-8e227896390b" continuedAt="F_000279_dcnt_cd99e0a2-7d5a-42a1-875e-e6d248106042"><ix:continuation id="F_000298_dcnt_69f36a5e-f987-4984-a023-5a243abd1ed3" continuedAt="F_000298_dcnt_4b219b0e-8e5c-43e9-bba5-8627a5708501"><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000300" name="us-gaap:ScheduleOfNewAccountingPronouncementsAndChangesInAccountingPrinciplesTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapAdjustmentsForNewAccountingPronouncementsAxis_us-gaapAccountingStandardsUpdate201602Member_20191001_20191231" escape="true">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The cumulative effect of initially applying the new leasing guidance to the Company&#8217;s Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements as of October&#160;1, 2019 was as follows (in millions):<br /></p>
<div>

<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;;font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>

<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:9.5pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>

<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:9.5pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Balance as of September 30, 2019</p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:1%; border-bottom:solid 0.75pt #000000;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:9.5pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>

<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:9.5pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Cumulative</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:9.5pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Impact from</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:9.5pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Adopting New</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:9.5pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Lease</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:9.5pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Standard</p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:1%; border-bottom:solid 0.75pt #000000;white-space:nowrap;">

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:9.5pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:9.5pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#CFF0FC;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:1%;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:9.5pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#CFF0FC;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:10.76%;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="text-align:right;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:9.5pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000353" name="us-gaap:LiabilitiesAndStockholdersEquity" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapAdjustmentsForNewAccountingPronouncementsAxis_us-gaapAccountingStandardsUpdate201602Member_20191001" decimals="-5" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" scale="6">5,745.3</ix:nonFraction></p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#CFF0FC;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:1%;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:1pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>
</tr>
</table></div></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">See Note&#160;12 of the Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements for additional information regarding the Company&#8217;s accounting for leases.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Standards not yet adopted</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">In June 2016, the FASB issued ASU 2016-13, <span style="font-style:italic;">Financial Instruments - Credit Losses (Topic 326), Measurement of Credit Losses on Financial Instruments</span>. The standard requires a change in the measurement approach for credit losses on financial assets measured on an amortized cost basis from an incurred loss method to an expected loss method, thereby eliminating the requirement that a credit loss be considered probable to impact the valuation of a financial asset measured on an amortized cost basis. The standard requires the measurement of expected credit losses to be based on relevant information about past events, including historical experience, current conditions, and a reasonable and supportable forecast that affects the collectability of the related financial asset. The Company will be required to adopt ASU 2016-13 as of October&#160;1, 2020. The Company is currently evaluating the impact of ASU 2016-13 on the Company&#8217;s consolidated financial statements.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">In January 2017, the FASB issued ASU 2017-04, <span style="font-style:italic;">Intangibles - Goodwill and Other (Topic 350), Simplifying the Test for Goodwill Impairment</span>. The standard simplifies the measurement of goodwill impairment by eliminating the requirement that an entity compute the implied fair value of goodwill based on the fair values of its assets and liabilities to measure impairment. Instead, goodwill impairment will be measured as the difference between the fair value of the reporting unit and the carrying value of the reporting unit. The standard also clarifies the treatment of the income tax effect of tax deductible goodwill when measuring goodwill impairment loss. The Company will be required to adopt ASU 2017-04 as of October&#160;1, 2020. The Company does not expect the adoption of ASU 2017-04 will have a material impact on the Company&#8217;s consolidated financial statements.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">In August 2018, the FASB issued ASU 2018-15, <span style="font-style:italic;">Intangibles - Goodwill and Other - Internal-Use Software (Subtopic 350-40): Customer&#8217;s Accounting for Implementation Costs Incurred in a Cloud Computing Arrangement That Is a Service Contract</span>. The standard aligns the requirements for capitalizing implementation costs incurred in a hosting arrangement that is a service contract with the requirements for capitalizing implementation costs incurred to develop or obtain internal-use software. The Company will be required to adopt ASU 2018-15 as of October 1, 2020. The Company intends to adopt the standard on a prospective basis and does not expect the adoption of ASU 2018-15 will have a material impact on the Company&#8217;s consolidated financial statements.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">In December 2019, the FASB issued ASU 2019-12, <span style="font-style:italic;">Income Taxes (Topic 740), Simplifying the Accounting for Income Taxes</span>. The standard simplifies the accounting for income taxes by removing certain exceptions to the general principles in ASC&#160;740 such as recognizing deferred taxes for equity investments, the incremental approach to performing intraperiod tax allocation and calculating income taxes in interim periods. The standard also simplifies accounting for income taxes under U.S. GAAP by </p></ix:continuation></ix:continuation>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">7</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" />
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:9pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><a href="#FOR_QUARTER_ENDED_MARCH_31_2019"><span style="text-decoration:underline;">Table of Contents</span></a></p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">OSHKOSH CORPORATION</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">NOTES TO CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">(Unaudited)</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p><ix:continuation id="F_000279_dcnt_cd99e0a2-7d5a-42a1-875e-e6d248106042"><ix:continuation id="F_000298_dcnt_4b219b0e-8e5c-43e9-bba5-8627a5708501">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">clarifying and amending existing guidance</span><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">, including </span><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">the recognition of</span><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"> deferred taxes for goodwill</span><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">,</span><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"> </span><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">the a</span><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">llocati</span><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">on of</span><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"> taxes to members of a consolidated group</span><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"> and requiring that an entity reflect the effect of enacted changes in tax laws or rates in the annual effective tax rate computation in the interim period that includes the enactment date</span><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">. The Company will be required to adopt ASU 2019-12 as of October 1, 2021. Early adoption is permitted. The Company is currently evaluating the impact of 2019-12 on the Company&#8217;s consolidated financial statements.</span></p></ix:continuation></ix:continuation>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000280" name="us-gaap:RevenueFromContractWithCustomerTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191001_20191231" escape="true" continuedAt="F_000280_dcnt_36989bba-f2a0-4f29-aefc-5add76732ba2">
<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">3.</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:bold;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Calibri;font-size:10pt;">Revenue Recognition</p></td></tr></table></div>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The defense segment recognizes revenue on its performance obligations that are satisfied over time by measuring progress using the cost-to-cost method of percentage-of-completion because it best depicts the transfer of control to the customer. Under the cost-to-cost method of percentage-of-completion, the defense segment measures progress based on the ratio of costs incurred to date to total estimated costs for the performance obligation. The Company recognizes changes in estimated sales or costs and the resulting profit or loss on a cumulative basis. Cumulative estimate-at-completion adjustments represent the cumulative effect of the changes on prior periods. If a loss is expected on a performance obligation, the complete estimated loss is recorded in the period in which the loss is identified. </p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">There is significant judgment involved in estimating sales and costs within the defense segment. Each contract is evaluated at contract inception to identify risks and estimate revenue and costs. In performing this evaluation, the defense segment considers risks of contract performance such as technical requirements, schedule, duration and key contract dependencies. These considerations are then factored into the Company&#8217;s estimated revenue and costs. Preliminary contract estimates are subject to change throughout the duration of the contract as additional information becomes available that impacts risks and estimated revenue and costs. In addition, as contract modifications (e.g., new orders) are received, the additional units are factored into the overall contract estimate of costs and transaction price. Contract adjustments in the defense segment increased net sales, operating income, net income and diluted earnings per share by $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000354" name="osk:IncreaseDecreaseInNetSalesDueToMarginRateAdjustments" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapStatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_oskDefenseMember_20191001_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">7.6</ix:nonFraction> million, $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000356" name="osk:IncreaseDecreaseInOperatingIncomeDueToMarginRateAdjustments" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapStatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_oskDefenseMember_20191001_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">3.8</ix:nonFraction> million, $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000358" name="osk:IncreaseDecreaseInNetIncomeDueToMarginRateAdjustments" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapStatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_oskDefenseMember_20191001_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">3.0</ix:nonFraction> million and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD_xbrlishares" id="F_000360" name="osk:IncreaseDecreaseInEarningsPerShareDueToMarginRateAdjustmentsInDollarPerShare" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapStatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_oskDefenseMember_20191001_20191231" decimals="2">0.04</ix:nonFraction> per share, respectively, during the three months ended December 31, 2019. Contract adjustments in the defense segment increased net sales, operating income, net income and diluted earnings per share by $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000355" name="osk:IncreaseDecreaseInNetSalesDueToMarginRateAdjustments" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapStatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_oskDefenseMember_20181001_20181231" decimals="-5" scale="6">31.6</ix:nonFraction> million, $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000357" name="osk:IncreaseDecreaseInOperatingIncomeDueToMarginRateAdjustments" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapStatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_oskDefenseMember_20181001_20181231" decimals="-5" scale="6">30.3</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million, $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000359" name="osk:IncreaseDecreaseInNetIncomeDueToMarginRateAdjustments" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapStatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_oskDefenseMember_20181001_20181231" decimals="-5" scale="6">23.2</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD_xbrlishares" id="F_000361" name="osk:IncreaseDecreaseInEarningsPerShareDueToMarginRateAdjustmentsInDollarPerShare" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapStatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_oskDefenseMember_20181001_20181231" decimals="2">0.32</ix:nonFraction> per share, respectively, during the three months ended December 31, 2018.</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><br /></p></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">8</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" />
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:9pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><a href="#FOR_QUARTER_ENDED_MARCH_31_2019"><span style="text-decoration:underline;">Table of Contents</span></a></p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">OSHKOSH CORPORATION</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">NOTES TO CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">(Unaudited)</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p><ix:continuation id="F_000280_dcnt_36989bba-f2a0-4f29-aefc-5add76732ba2" continuedAt="F_000280_dcnt_c9a830bd-3f75-48b2-8174-5e8ed92e1594">

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;font-weight:bold;color:#000000;font-size:9.5pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>

<p style="text-align:right;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:9.5pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">(<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000395" name="us-gaap:RevenueFromContractWithCustomerExcludingAssessedTax" contextRef="C_0000775158_srtConsolidationItemsAxis_us-gaapIntersegmentEliminationMember_20181001_20181231" decimals="-5" sign="-" scale="6">4.9</ix:nonFraction></p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#CFF0FC;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:1%; border-top:solid 0.75pt #000000; border-bottom:double 2.5pt #000000;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:9.5pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">)</p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#CFF0FC;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;width:0.96%; border-bottom:double 2.5pt transparent;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:9.5pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#CFF0FC;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:1%; border-top:solid 0.75pt #000000; border-bottom:double 2.5pt #000000;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:9.5pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">$</p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#CFF0FC;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:9.8%; border-top:solid 0.75pt #000000; border-bottom:double 2.5pt #000000;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="text-align:right;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:9.5pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000396" name="us-gaap:RevenueFromContractWithCustomerExcludingAssessedTax" contextRef="C_0000775158_20181001_20181231" decimals="-5" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" scale="6">1,803.4</ix:nonFraction></p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#CFF0FC;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:1%; border-top:solid 0.75pt #000000; border-bottom:double 2.5pt #000000;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:1pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>
</tr>
</table></div>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p></ix:continuation>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">See Note 20 of the Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements for further disaggregated sales information.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:0%;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Contract Assets and Contract Liabilities</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company is generally entitled to bill its customers upon satisfaction of its performance obligations, with the exception of its long-term contracts in the defense segment which typically allow for billing upon acceptance of the finished good, advance payments from customers primarily within the fire &#38; emergency segment and extended warranties that are usually billed in advance of the warranty coverage period. Customer payment is usually received shortly after billing and payment terms generally do not exceed one year. With the exception of the fire &#38; emergency segment, the Company&#8217;s contracts typically do not contain a significant financing component. In the fire &#38; emergency segment, customers earn interest on customer advances at a rate determined in a separate financing transaction between the fire &#38; emergency segment and the customer at contract inception. Interest due on customer advances of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000397" name="us-gaap:InterestExpenseCustomerDeposits" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapStatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_oskFireAndEmergencyMember_20191001_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">3.2</ix:nonFraction> million and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000398" name="us-gaap:InterestExpenseCustomerDeposits" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapStatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_oskFireAndEmergencyMember_20181001_20181231" decimals="-5" scale="6">3.6</ix:nonFraction> million was recorded in &#8220;Interest expense&#8221; in the Condensed Consolidated Statements of Income for the three months ended December 31, 2019 and 2018, respectively. </p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The timing of billing does not always match the timing of revenue recognition. In instances where a customer pays consideration in advance or when the Company is entitled to bill a customer in advance of recognizing the related revenue, the Company records a contract liability within &#8220;Customer advances&#8221;, &#8220;Other current liabilities&#8221; or &#8220;Other long-term liabilities&#8221; in the Condensed Consolidated Balance Sheet. Total contract liabilities were $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000399" name="us-gaap:ContractWithCustomerLiability" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">534.4</ix:nonFraction> million as of December 31, 2019, of which $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000401" name="us-gaap:ContractWithCustomerLiabilityCurrent" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">407.2</ix:nonFraction> million, $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000403" name="osk:ContractWithCustomerOtherCurrentLiability" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">75.3</ix:nonFraction> million and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000405" name="us-gaap:ContractWithCustomerLiabilityNoncurrent" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">51.9</ix:nonFraction> million was included in &#8220;Customer advances&#8221;, &#8220;Other current liabilities&#8221; and &#8220;Other long-term liabilities&#8221;, respectively. Total contract liabilities were $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000400" name="us-gaap:ContractWithCustomerLiability" contextRef="C_0000775158_20190930" decimals="-5" scale="6">512.5</ix:nonFraction> million as of September 30, 2019, of which $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000402" name="us-gaap:ContractWithCustomerLiabilityCurrent" contextRef="C_0000775158_20190930" decimals="-5" scale="6">382.0</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million, $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000404" name="osk:ContractWithCustomerOtherCurrentLiability" contextRef="C_0000775158_20190930" decimals="-5" scale="6">78.2</ix:nonFraction> million and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000406" name="us-gaap:ContractWithCustomerLiabilityNoncurrent" contextRef="C_0000775158_20190930" decimals="-5" scale="6">52.3</ix:nonFraction> million was included in &#8220;Customer advances&#8221;, &#8220;Other current liabilities&#8221; and &#8220;Other long-term liabilities&#8221;, respectively. The Company reduces contract liabilities when revenue is recognized. The Company recognized $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000407" name="us-gaap:ContractWithCustomerLiabilityRevenueRecognized" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191001_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">172.9</ix:nonFraction> million and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000408" name="us-gaap:ContractWithCustomerLiabilityRevenueRecognized" contextRef="C_0000775158_20181001_20181231" decimals="-5" scale="6">236.0</ix:nonFraction> million of revenue that was recorded as a contract liability as of the beginning of the period during the three months ended December 31, 2019 and 2018, respectively.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">In instances where the Company recognizes revenue prior to having an unconditional right to payment, the Company records a contract asset within &#8220;Unbilled receivables, net&#8221; in the Condensed Consolidated Balance Sheet. The Company reduces contract assets when the Company has an unconditional right to payment. The Company periodically assesses its contract assets for impairment. Contract assets and liabilities are determined on a net basis for each contract. The Company did not record any impairment losses on contracts from customers during the three months ended December 31, 2019 and 2018, respectively. See Note&#160;8 of the Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements for additional information on the Company&#8217;s receivable balances.</p></ix:continuation>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">9</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" />
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:9pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><a href="#FOR_QUARTER_ENDED_MARCH_31_2019"><span style="text-decoration:underline;">Table of Contents</span></a></p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">OSHKOSH CORPORATION</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">NOTES TO CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">(Unaudited)</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p><ix:continuation id="F_000280_dcnt_c9a830bd-3f75-48b2-8174-5e8ed92e1594">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company offers a variety of service-type warranties, including optionally priced extended warranty programs. Outstanding balances related to service-type warranties are included within contract liabilities disclosed above. Revenue related to service warranties is deferred until after the expiration of the standard warranty period. The revenue is then recognized in income over the term of the extended warranty period in proportion to the costs that are expected to be incurred. </span><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000302" name="us-gaap:ScheduleOfProductWarrantyLiabilityTableTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191001_20191231" escape="true" continuedAt="F_000302_cnt_1">Changes in the Company&#8217;s service-type warranties were as follows (in millions):</ix:nonNumeric></span></p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p><ix:continuation id="F_000302_cnt_1" continuedAt="F_000302_cnt_2">

<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p></ix:continuation>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Remaining Performance Obligations</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">As of December 31, 2019, the Company had unsatisfied performance obligations for contracts with an original duration greater than one year totaling $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000425" name="us-gaap:RevenueRemainingPerformanceObligation" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191231" decimals="-7" scale="9">4.28</ix:nonFraction> billion, of which $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000426" name="osk:TransactionPriceAllocatedToPerformanceObligationsToBeSatisfiedDuringCurrentFiscalYear" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191231" decimals="-7" scale="9">2.64</ix:nonFraction> billion is expected to be satisfied and revenue recognized in the remaining nine months of fiscal 2020, $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000427" name="osk:TransactionPriceAllocateToPerformanceObligationsExpectedToBeSatisfiedDuringTheSubsequentFiscalYear" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191231" decimals="-7" scale="9">1.44</ix:nonFraction> billion is expected to be satisfied and revenue recognized in fiscal 2021 and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000428" name="osk:TransactionPriceAllocatedToPerformanceObligationsExpectedToBeSatisfiedBeyondSubsequentFiscalYear" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">202.8</ix:nonFraction> million is expected to be satisfied and revenue recognized beyond fiscal 2021. </p></ix:continuation>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000281" name="us-gaap:DisclosureOfCompensationRelatedCostsShareBasedPaymentsTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191001_20191231" escape="true">
<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">4.</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:bold;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Calibri;font-size:10pt;">Stock-Based Compensation</p></td></tr></table></div>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">In February&#160;2017, the Company&#8217;s shareholders approved the 2017&#160;Incentive Stock and Awards Plan (the &#8220;2017&#160;Stock Plan&#8221;). The 2017&#160;Stock Plan replaced the 2009&#160;Incentive Stock and Awards Plan (as amended, the &#8220;2009&#160;Stock Plan&#8221;). While no new awards will be granted under the 2009 Stock Plan, awards previously made under that plan that were outstanding as of the approval date of the 2017&#160;Stock Plan will remain outstanding and continue to be governed by the provisions of that plan. At December 31, 2019, the Company had reserved <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlishares" id="F_000429" name="us-gaap:ShareBasedCompensationArrangementByShareBasedPaymentAwardNumberOfSharesAuthorized" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191231" decimals="INF" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">6,025,328</ix:nonFraction> shares of Common Stock available for issuance to provide for the exercise of outstanding stock options and the issuance of Common Stock under incentive compensation awards, including awards issued prior to the effective date of the 2017&#160;Stock Plan.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company recognizes stock-based compensation expense over the requisite service period for vesting of an award, or to an employee&#8217;s eligible retirement date, if earlier and applicable. Total stock-based compensation expense, including cash-based liability awards, for the three months ended December 31, 2019 was $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000430" name="us-gaap:AllocatedShareBasedCompensationExpense" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191001_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">10.7</ix:nonFraction> million ($<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000432" name="us-gaap:AllocatedShareBasedCompensationExpenseNetOfTax" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191001_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">8.9</ix:nonFraction> million net of tax). Total stock-based compensation expense, including cash-based liability awards, for the three months ended December 31, 2018 was $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000431" name="us-gaap:AllocatedShareBasedCompensationExpense" contextRef="C_0000775158_20181001_20181231" decimals="-5" scale="6">7.6</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million ($<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000433" name="us-gaap:AllocatedShareBasedCompensationExpenseNetOfTax" contextRef="C_0000775158_20181001_20181231" decimals="-5" scale="6">6.5</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million net of tax).</p></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">10</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" />
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:9pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><a href="#FOR_QUARTER_ENDED_MARCH_31_2019"><span style="text-decoration:underline;">Table of Contents</span></a></p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">OSHKOSH CORPORATION</p>

<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">(Unaudited)</p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="margin:auto;border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;width:66.98%; border-bottom:solid 0.75pt transparent;">

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Components of net periodic benefit cost other than &#8220;Service cost&#8221; and &#8220;Expenses paid&#8221; are included in &#8220;Miscellaneous, net&#8221; in the Condensed Consolidated Statements of Income. Administrative expense for the three-months ended December 31, 2018, which was previously included in &#8220;Service cost&#8221;, is now reported in &#8220;Expenses paid&#8221; to improve the comparability between the periods.</p></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000283" name="us-gaap:IncomeTaxDisclosureTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191001_20191231" escape="true" continuedAt="F_000283_dcnt_6bcb3287-7dc1-45a0-80d8-7871cb81a2ee">
<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">6.</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:bold;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Calibri;font-size:10pt;">Income Taxes</p></td></tr></table></div>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company recorded income tax expense of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000457" name="us-gaap:IncomeTaxExpenseBenefit" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191001_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">20.7</ix:nonFraction> million for the three months ended December 31, 2019, or <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000459" name="us-gaap:EffectiveIncomeTaxRateContinuingOperations" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191001_20191231" decimals="3" scale="-2">21.4</ix:nonFraction>% of pre-tax income, compared to $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000458" name="us-gaap:IncomeTaxExpenseBenefit" contextRef="C_0000775158_20181001_20181231" decimals="-5" scale="6">39.7</ix:nonFraction> million, or <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000460" name="us-gaap:EffectiveIncomeTaxRateContinuingOperations" contextRef="C_0000775158_20181001_20181231" decimals="3" scale="-2">26.9</ix:nonFraction>% of pre-tax income, for the three months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2018. Results for the three months ended December 31, 2019 were favorably impacted by $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000461" name="osk:IncomeTaxExpenseBenefitTaxCreditDiscreteItems" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191001_20191231" decimals="-5" sign="-" scale="6">1.1</ix:nonFraction> million of net discrete tax benefits, including a $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000463" name="us-gaap:EmployeeServiceShareBasedCompensationTaxBenefitFromCompensationExpense" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191001_20191231" decimals="-5" sign="-" scale="6">1.5</ix:nonFraction> million benefit related to employee stock-based compensation payments. Results for the three months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2018 were unfavorably impacted by $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000462" name="osk:IncomeTaxExpenseBenefitTaxCreditDiscreteItems" contextRef="C_0000775158_20181001_20181231" decimals="-5" scale="6">7.3</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million of net discrete tax charges, including $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000464" name="us-gaap:UnrecognizedTaxBenefitsPeriodIncreaseDecrease" contextRef="C_0000775158_20181001_20181231" decimals="-5" scale="6">6.2</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million of charges related to uncertain tax position reserves and a $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000465" name="us-gaap:TaxCutsAndJobsActOf2017TransitionTaxForAccumulatedForeignEarningsIncomeTaxExpense" contextRef="C_0000775158_20181001_20181231" decimals="-5" scale="6">0.8</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million charge related to adjustments to the repatriation tax required under tax legislation enacted in the United States in December&#160;2017.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company&#8217;s liability for gross unrecognized tax benefits, excluding related interest and penalties, was $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000466" name="us-gaap:UnrecognizedTaxBenefits" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">106.0</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000467" name="us-gaap:UnrecognizedTaxBenefits" contextRef="C_0000775158_20190930" decimals="-5" scale="6">97.3</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million as of December 31, 2019 and September&#160;30,&#160;2019, respectively. As of December 31, 2019, net unrecognized tax benefits, excluding interest and penalties, of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000468" name="osk:UnrecognizedTaxBenefitsThatWouldImpactNetIncome" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">21.4</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million would affect the Company&#8217;s net income if recognized.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company recognizes accrued interest and penalties, if any, related to unrecognized tax benefits in the &#8220;Provision for income taxes&#8221; in the Condensed Consolidated Statements of Income. During the three months ended December&#160;31,&#160;2019 and 2018, the Company recognized a benefit of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000469" name="osk:UnrecognizedTaxBenefitsIncomeTaxPenaltiesAndInterestExpenseIncome" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191001_20191231" decimals="-5" sign="-" scale="6">0.1</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million and expense of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000470" name="osk:UnrecognizedTaxBenefitsIncomeTaxPenaltiesAndInterestExpenseIncome" contextRef="C_0000775158_20181001_20181231" decimals="-5" scale="6">0.2</ix:nonFraction> million, respectively, related to interest and penalties. At December&#160;31,&#160;2019, the Company had accruals for the payment of interest and penalties of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000471" name="us-gaap:UnrecognizedTaxBenefitsIncomeTaxPenaltiesAndInterestAccrued" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">4.3</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million. During the next twelve months, it is reasonably possible that federal, state and foreign tax audit resolutions could reduce net </p></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">11</p>

<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">OSHKOSH CORPORATION</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">NOTES TO CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">(Unaudited)</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p><ix:continuation id="F_000283_dcnt_6bcb3287-7dc1-45a0-80d8-7871cb81a2ee">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">unrecognized tax benefits by approximately </span><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">$<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000472" name="us-gaap:SignificantChangeInUnrecognizedTaxBenefitsIsReasonablyPossibleAmountOfUnrecordedBenefit" contextRef="C_0000775158_srtStatementScenarioAxis_srtScenarioForecastMember_20201231" decimals="-5" scale="6">7.2</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million</span><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"> because the Company&#8217;s tax positions are sustained on audit, the Company agrees to their disallowance or the statutes of limitations close.</span></p></ix:continuation><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000284" name="us-gaap:EarningsPerShareTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191001_20191231" escape="true">

<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000308" name="osk:ScheduleOfClassificationOfReceivablesTableTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191001_20191231" escape="true">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Classification of receivables in the Condensed Consolidated Balance Sheets consisted of the following (in millions):</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>
<div>
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="margin:auto;border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;width:69.82%; border-bottom:solid 0.75pt transparent;">

<p style="text-align:right;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:9.5pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000552" name="us-gaap:PropertyPlantAndEquipmentNet" contextRef="C_0000775158_20190930" decimals="-5" scale="6">573.6</ix:nonFraction></p></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#CFF0FC;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:1%; border-top:solid 0.75pt #000000; border-bottom:double 2.5pt #000000;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:1pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>

</table></div>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Depreciation expense was $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000553" name="us-gaap:Depreciation" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191001_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">20.3</ix:nonFraction> million and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000554" name="us-gaap:Depreciation" contextRef="C_0000775158_20181001_20181231" decimals="-5" scale="6">19.1</ix:nonFraction> million for the three months ended December 31, 2019 and 2018, respectively. Capitalized interest was insignificant for all reported periods.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Equipment on operating lease to others represents the cost of equipment shipped to customers for whom the Company has guaranteed the residual value and equipment on short-term leases. These transactions are accounted for as operating leases with the related assets capitalized and depreciated over their estimated economic lives of <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000555" name="us-gaap:PropertyPlantAndEquipmentUsefulLife" contextRef="C_0000775158_srtRangeAxis_srtMinimumMember_us-gaapPropertyPlantAndEquipmentByTypeAxis_us-gaapEquipmentLeasedToOtherPartyMember_20191001_20191231" format="ixt-sec:durwordsen" continuedAt="C_09cd7999-72cf-4424-b417-ae1a27dbb39c">five</ix:nonNumeric> to <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000556" name="us-gaap:PropertyPlantAndEquipmentUsefulLife" contextRef="C_0000775158_srtRangeAxis_srtMaximumMember_us-gaapPropertyPlantAndEquipmentByTypeAxis_us-gaapEquipmentLeasedToOtherPartyMember_20191001_20191231" format="ixt-sec:durwordsen">ten<ix:continuation id="C_09cd7999-72cf-4424-b417-ae1a27dbb39c"> years</ix:continuation></ix:nonNumeric>. Cost less accumulated depreciation for equipment on operating lease at December 31, 2019 and September&#160;30, 2019 was $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000557" name="us-gaap:PropertySubjectToOrAvailableForOperatingLeaseNet" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapPropertyPlantAndEquipmentByTypeAxis_us-gaapEquipmentLeasedToOtherPartyMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">17.3</ix:nonFraction> million and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000558" name="us-gaap:PropertySubjectToOrAvailableForOperatingLeaseNet" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapPropertyPlantAndEquipmentByTypeAxis_us-gaapEquipmentLeasedToOtherPartyMember_20190930" decimals="-5" scale="6">31.3</ix:nonFraction> million, respectively.</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><br /></p></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">13</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" />
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:9pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><a href="#FOR_QUARTER_ENDED_MARCH_31_2019"><span style="text-decoration:underline;">Table of Contents</span></a></p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">OSHKOSH CORPORATION</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">NOTES TO CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">(Unaudited)</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000288" name="us-gaap:GoodwillAndIntangibleAssetsDisclosureTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191001_20191231" escape="true" continuedAt="F_000288_dcnt_89305dc1-6a26-48c7-9345-a26f50ffacf7">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">11.<span style="margin-left:36pt;">Goodwill and Purchased Intangible Assets</span></p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Goodwill and other indefinite-lived intangible assets are not amortized but are reviewed for impairment annually or more frequently if potential interim indicators exist that could result in impairment. The Company performs its annual impairment test in the fourth quarter of its fiscal year.</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000312" name="us-gaap:ScheduleOfGoodwillTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191001_20191231" escape="true">

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p></ix:nonNumeric></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">14</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" />
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:9pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><a href="#FOR_QUARTER_ENDED_MARCH_31_2019"><span style="text-decoration:underline;">Table of Contents</span></a></p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">OSHKOSH CORPORATION</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">NOTES TO CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">(Unaudited)</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p><ix:continuation id="F_000288_dcnt_89305dc1-6a26-48c7-9345-a26f50ffacf7"><ix:continuation id="F_000314_dcnt_e02564c2-20a3-4a4a-9305-09d9dd5c3b41"></ix:continuation>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The estimated future amortization expense of purchased intangible assets for the remainder of fiscal 2020 and the five years succeeding September&#160;30, 2020 are as follows: 2020 (remaining nine months) - $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000641" name="us-gaap:FiniteLivedIntangibleAssetsAmortizationExpenseRemainderOfFiscalYear" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">4.0</ix:nonFraction> million&#59; 2021&#160;-&#160;$<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000642" name="us-gaap:FiniteLivedIntangibleAssetsAmortizationExpenseNextTwelveMonths" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">5.3</ix:nonFraction> million&#59; 2022&#160;-&#160;$<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000643" name="us-gaap:FiniteLivedIntangibleAssetsAmortizationExpenseYearTwo" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">4.9</ix:nonFraction> million&#59; 2023&#160;-&#160;$<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000644" name="us-gaap:FiniteLivedIntangibleAssetsAmortizationExpenseYearThree" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">3.5</ix:nonFraction> million&#59; 2024&#160;-&#160;$<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000645" name="us-gaap:FiniteLivedIntangibleAssetsAmortizationExpenseYearFour" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">1.7</ix:nonFraction> million&#59; and 2025&#160;-&#160;$<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000646" name="us-gaap:FiniteLivedIntangibleAssetsAmortizationExpenseYearFive" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">1.5</ix:nonFraction> million.</p></ix:continuation>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000289" name="us-gaap:LesseeOperatingLeasesTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191001_20191231" escape="true" continuedAt="F_000289_dcnt_a273a037-323a-46e5-bbaa-b67103ab26d8">
<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">1</span><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">2</span><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">.</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:bold;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Calibri;font-size:10pt;">Leases</p></td></tr></table></div>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company leases certain real estate, information technology equipment, warehouse equipment, vehicles and other equipment almost exclusively through operating leases. The Company determines whether an arrangement contains a lease at inception. A lease liability and corresponding ROU asset are recognized for qualifying leased assets based on the present value of fixed and certain index based lease payments at lease commencement. Variable payments, which are generally determined based on the usage rate of the underlying asset, are excluded from the present value of lease payments and are recognized in the period in which the payment is made. To determine the present value of lease payments, the Company uses the stated interest rate in the lease, when available, or more commonly a secured incremental borrowing rate that reflects risk, term and economic environment in which the lease is denominated. The incremental borrowing rate is determined using a portfolio approach based on the current rate of interest that the Company would have to pay to borrow an amount equal to the lease payments on a collateralized basis over a similar term. The Company has elected not to separate payments for lease components from payments for non-lease components in contracts that contain both components. Lease agreements may include options to extend or terminate the lease. Those options that are reasonably certain of exercise at lease commencement have been included in the term of the lease used to recognize the ROU assets and lease liabilities. The lease term of the Company&#8217;s real estate and equipment leases extend up to <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000648" name="us-gaap:LesseeOperatingLeaseTermOfContract" contextRef="C_0000775158_srtRangeAxis_srtMaximumMember_us-gaapPropertyPlantAndEquipmentByTypeAxis_us-gaapLandAndBuildingMember_20191231" format="ixt-sec:duryear">29</ix:nonNumeric> years and <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000649" name="us-gaap:LesseeOperatingLeaseTermOfContract" contextRef="C_0000775158_srtRangeAxis_srtMaximumMember_us-gaapPropertyPlantAndEquipmentByTypeAxis_us-gaapEquipmentMember_20191231" format="ixt-sec:duryear">16</ix:nonNumeric> years, respectively. The Company has elected not to recognize ROU assets or lease liabilities for leases with a term of twelve months or less. Expense is recognized on a straight-line basis over the lease term for operating leases. The Company&#8217;s finance leases are not significant.</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000315" name="us-gaap:LeaseCostTableTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191001_20191231" escape="true">
