<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:1pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>
</tr>
</table></div>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">On April&#160;3, 2018, the Company entered into a Second Amended and Restated Credit Agreement with various lenders (the &#8220;Credit Agreement&#8221;). The Credit Agreement provides for (i)&#160;an unsecured revolving credit facility (the &#8220;Revolving Credit Facility&#8221;) that matures in April&#160;2023 with an initial maximum aggregate amount of availability of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000719" name="us-gaap:LineOfCreditFacilityMaximumBorrowingCapacity" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapCreditFacilityAxis_us-gaapRevolvingCreditFacilityMember_20180403" decimals="INF" scale="6">850</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million and (ii)&#160;an unsecured $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000720" name="us-gaap:LongTermDebt" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_oskSeniorTermLoanMemberMember_20180403" decimals="-6" scale="6">325</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million term loan (the &#8220;Term Loan&#8221;) due in quarterly principal installments of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000721" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentPeriodicPaymentPrincipal" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_oskSeniorTermLoanMemberMember_20191001_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">4.1</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million commencing September&#160;30,&#160;2019 with a balloon payment of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000722" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentPeriodicPaymentTermsBalloonPaymentToBePaid" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_oskSeniorTermLoanMemberMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">264.1</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million due at maturity in April&#160;2023. During fiscal 2018, the Company prepaid all required quarterly principal installments on the Term Loan through June 2022.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">At December 31, 2019, outstanding letters of credit of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000723" name="us-gaap:LettersOfCreditOutstandingAmount" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">63.5</ix:nonFraction> million reduced available capacity under the Revolving Credit Facility to $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000724" name="us-gaap:LineOfCreditFacilityCurrentBorrowingCapacity" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapCreditFacilityAxis_us-gaapRevolvingCreditFacilityMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">786.5</ix:nonFraction> million.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Under the Credit Agreement, the Company is obligated to pay (i)&#160;an unused commitment fee ranging from <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000725" name="us-gaap:LineOfCreditFacilityUnusedCapacityCommitmentFeePercentage" contextRef="C_0000775158_srtRangeAxis_srtMinimumMember_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_oskSeniorCreditAgreementMemberMember_20191001_20191231" decimals="INF" scale="-2">0.125</ix:nonFraction>% to <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000727" name="us-gaap:LineOfCreditFacilityUnusedCapacityCommitmentFeePercentage" contextRef="C_0000775158_srtRangeAxis_srtMaximumMember_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_oskSeniorCreditAgreementMemberMember_20191001_20191231" decimals="INF" scale="-2">0.275</ix:nonFraction>% per annum of the average daily unused portion of the aggregate revolving credit commitments under the Credit Agreement and (ii)&#160;a fee ranging from <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000726" name="osk:LetterOfCreditFeesPercentageOnAvailableBorrowingCapacityLowEndOfRange" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191001_20191231" decimals="5" scale="-2">0.563</ix:nonFraction>% to <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000728" name="osk:LetterOfCreditRatePercentageOnAvailableBorrowingCapacityHighEndOfRange" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191001_20191231" decimals="4" scale="-2">1.75</ix:nonFraction>% per annum of the maximum amount available to be drawn for each letter of credit issued and outstanding under the Credit Agreement.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Borrowings under the Credit Agreement bear interest at a variable rate equal to (i)&#160;LIBOR plus a specified margin, which may be adjusted upward or downward depending on whether certain criteria are satisfied, or (ii)&#160;for dollar-denominated loans only, the base rate (which is the highest of (a)&#160;the administrative agent&#8217;s prime rate, (b)&#160;the federal funds rate plus <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000729" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentBasisSpreadOnVariableRate1" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_oskSeniorCreditAgreementMemberMember_us-gaapVariableRateAxis_oskDebtInstrumentVariableRateBaseFederalMember_20191001_20191231" decimals="INF" scale="-2">0.50</ix:nonFraction>% or (c)&#160;the sum of <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000730" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentBasisSpreadOnVariableRate1" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_oskSeniorCreditAgreementMemberMember_us-gaapVariableRateAxis_oskDebtInstrumentVariableRateBaseLIBORMember_20191001_20191231" decimals="INF" scale="-2">1</ix:nonFraction>% plus one-month LIBOR) plus a specified margin, which may be adjusted upward or downward depending on whether certain criteria are satisfied. At December 31, 2019, the interest spread on the Revolving Credit Facility and Term Loan was <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000731" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentBasisSpreadOnVariableRate1" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_oskSeniorCreditAgreementMemberMember_20191001_20191231" decimals="INF" scale="-4">125</ix:nonFraction> basis points. The weighted-average interest rate on borrowings outstanding under the Term Loan at December&#160;31,&#160;2019 was <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000732" name="us-gaap:DebtWeightedAverageInterestRate" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_oskSeniorTermLoanMemberMember_20191231" decimals="4" scale="-2">3.05</ix:nonFraction>%.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Credit Agreement contains various restrictions and covenants, including requirements that the Company maintain certain financial ratios at prescribed levels and restrictions, subject to certain exceptions, on the ability of the Company and certain of its subsidiaries to consolidate or merge, create liens, incur additional indebtedness, dispose of assets, and consummate acquisitions.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Credit Agreement contains the following financial covenants:</p>
<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;font-size:10pt;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#8226;</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Calibri;">Leverage Ratio: A maximum leverage ratio (defined as, with certain adjustments, the ratio of the Company&#8217;s consolidated indebtedness to consolidated net income before interest, taxes, depreciation, amortization, non-cash charges and certain other items (EBITDA)) as of the last day of any fiscal quarter of <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000733" name="osk:DebtInstrumentLeverageRatio" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_oskSeniorCreditAgreementMemberMember_20191231" decimals="INF">3.75</ix:nonFraction> to 1.00.</span></p></td></tr></table></div>
<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">

<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;font-size:10pt;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#8226;</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Calibri;">Interest Coverage Ratio: A minimum interest coverage ratio (defined as, with certain adjustments, the ratio of the Company&#8217;s consolidated EBITDA to the Company&#8217;s consolidated cash interest expense) as of the last day of any fiscal quarter of <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000734" name="osk:DebtInstrumentCovenantTermsInterestCoverageRatio" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_oskSeniorCreditAgreementMemberMember_20191231" decimals="INF">2.50</ix:nonFraction> to 1.00.</span></p></td></tr></table></div></ix:continuation>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">17</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" />
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:9pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><a href="#FOR_QUARTER_ENDED_MARCH_31_2019"><span style="text-decoration:underline;">Table of Contents</span></a></p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">OSHKOSH CORPORATION</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">NOTES TO CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">(Unaudited)</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p><ix:continuation id="F_000290_dcnt_57fe4e78-0049-41df-b655-75ee544c8517">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">With certain exceptions, the Credit Agreement limits the ability of the Company to pay dividends and other distributions, including repurchases of shares of its Common Stock. However, so long as no event of default exists under the Credit Agreement or would result from such payment, the Company may pay dividends and other distributions after April 3, 2018, in an </span><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">aggregate amount not exceeding</span><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"> the sum of:</span></p>
<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Calibri;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">i.</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Calibri;font-size:10pt;">$<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000735" name="osk:DebtInstrumentDividendsAndOtherDistributionsRestrictionsDollarRestriction" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_oskSeniorCreditAgreementMemberMember_20191001_20191231" decimals="-7" scale="9">1.46</ix:nonFraction> billion&#59;</p></td></tr></table></div>
<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Calibri;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">ii.</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Calibri;font-size:10pt;"><ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000736" name="osk:DebtInstrumentDividendsAndOtherDistributionsRestrictionsPercentageOfConsolidatedNetIncomeConsidered" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_oskSeniorCreditAgreementMemberMember_20191001_20191231" decimals="INF" scale="-2">50</ix:nonFraction>% of the consolidated net income of the Company and its subsidiaries (or if such consolidated net income is a deficit, minus <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000737" name="osk:DebtInstrumentDividendsAndOtherDistributionsRestrictionsPercentageOfConsolidatedNetDeficitDeducted" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_oskSeniorCreditAgreementMemberMember_20191001_20191231" decimals="INF" scale="-2">100</ix:nonFraction>% of such deficit), accrued on a cumulative basis during the period beginning on April&#160;3,&#160;2018 and ending on the last day of the fiscal quarter immediately preceding the date of the applicable proposed dividend or distribution&#59; and</p></td></tr></table></div>
<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Calibri;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">iii.</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Calibri;font-size:10pt;"><ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000738" name="osk:DebtInstrumentDividendsAndOtherDistributionsRestrictionsPercentageOfAggregateNetProceedsReceived" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_oskSeniorCreditAgreementMemberMember_20191001_20191231" decimals="INF" scale="-2">100</ix:nonFraction>% of the aggregate net proceeds received by the Company subsequent to April&#160;3, 2018 either as a contribution to its common equity capital or from the issuance and sale of its Common Stock.</p></td></tr></table></div>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company was in compliance with the financial covenants contained in the Credit Agreement as of December&#160;31,&#160;2019.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">In March&#160;2015, the Company issued $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000739" name="us-gaap:ProceedsFromIssuanceOfDebt" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_oskA5375SeniorNotesDueMarch2025Member_20150331_20150331" decimals="-5" scale="6">250.0</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million of <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000740" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentInterestRateStatedPercentage" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_oskA5375SeniorNotesDueMarch2025Member_20191231" decimals="INF" scale="-2"><ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000741" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentInterestRateStatedPercentage" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_oskA5375SeniorNotesDueMarch2025Member_20150331" decimals="INF" scale="-2">5.375</ix:nonFraction></ix:nonFraction>% unsecured senior notes due March&#160;1, 2025 (the &#8220;2025&#160;Senior Notes&#8221;). The proceeds of the note issuance were used to repay existing outstanding notes of the Company. On May&#160;17,&#160;2018, the Company issued $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000742" name="us-gaap:ProceedsFromIssuanceOfDebt" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_oskA4600SeniorNotesDueMay2028Member_20180517_20180517" decimals="-5" scale="6">300.0</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million of <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000743" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentInterestRateStatedPercentage" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_oskA4600SeniorNotesDueMay2028Member_20191231" decimals="INF" scale="-2"><ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000744" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentInterestRateStatedPercentage" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_oskA4600SeniorNotesDueMay2028Member_20180517" decimals="INF" scale="-2">4.600</ix:nonFraction></ix:nonFraction>% unsecured senior notes due May&#160;15, 2028 (the &#8220;2028&#160;Senior Notes&#8221;). The Company used the net proceeds from the sale of the 2028&#160;Senior Notes to repay certain outstanding notes of the Company and to pre-pay $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000745" name="us-gaap:RepaymentsOfDebt" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_oskSeniorTermLoanMemberMember_20180517_20180517" decimals="-5" scale="6">49.2</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million of quarterly principal installment payments under the Term Loan. The 2025&#160;Senior Notes and the 2028&#160;Senior Notes were issued pursuant to separate indentures (the &#8220;Indentures&#8221;) between the Company and a trustee. The Indentures contain customary affirmative and negative covenants. The Company has the option to redeem the 2025&#160;Senior Notes for a premium after March&#160;1, 2020. The Company has the option to redeem the 2028&#160;Senior Notes at any time for a premium.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The fair value of the long-term debt is estimated based upon Level 2 inputs to reflect market rate of the Company&#8217;s debt. At December 31, 2019, the fair value of the 2025&#160;Senior Notes and the 2028&#160;Senior Notes was estimated to be $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000746" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentFairValue" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_oskA5375SeniorNotesDueMarch2025Member_20191231" decimals="-6" scale="6">258</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million ($<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000747" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentFairValue" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_oskA5375SeniorNotesDueMarch2025Member_20190930" decimals="-6" scale="6">259</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million at September&#160;30, 2019) and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000748" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentFairValue" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_oskA4600SeniorNotesDueMay2028Member_20191231" decimals="-6" scale="6">326</ix:nonFraction> million ($<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000749" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentFairValue" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_oskA4600SeniorNotesDueMay2028Member_20190930" decimals="-6" scale="6">322</ix:nonFraction> million at September&#160;30, 2019), respectively. The fair value of the Term Loan approximated book value at both December 31, 2019 and September&#160;30, 2019. See Note 19 of the Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements for the definition of a Level 2 input.</p></ix:continuation>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">18</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" />
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:9pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><a href="#FOR_QUARTER_ENDED_MARCH_31_2019"><span style="text-decoration:underline;">Table of Contents</span></a></p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">OSHKOSH CORPORATION</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">NOTES TO CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">(Unaudited)</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000291" name="us-gaap:ProductWarrantyDisclosureTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191001_20191231" escape="true">
<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">1</span><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">4</span><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">.</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:bold;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Calibri;font-size:10pt;">Warranties</p></td></tr></table></div>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company&#8217;s products generally carry explicit warranties that extend from <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000750" name="osk:StandardProductWarrantyTerm" contextRef="C_0000775158_srtRangeAxis_srtMinimumMember_20191001_20191231" format="ixt-sec:durwordsen">six months</ix:nonNumeric> to <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000751" name="osk:StandardProductWarrantyTerm" contextRef="C_0000775158_srtRangeAxis_srtMaximumMember_20191001_20191231" format="ixt-sec:durwordsen">five years</ix:nonNumeric>, based on terms that are generally accepted in the marketplace. Selected components (such as engines, transmissions, tires,&#160;etc.) included in the Company&#8217;s end products may include manufacturers&#8217; warranties. These manufacturers&#8217; warranties are generally passed on to the end customer of the Company&#8217;s products, and the customer would generally deal directly with the component manufacturer.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Provisions for estimated warranty and other related costs are recorded at the time of sale and are periodically adjusted to reflect actual experience. Certain warranty and other related claims involve matters of dispute that ultimately are resolved by negotiation, arbitration or litigation. At times, warranty issues arise that are beyond the scope of the Company&#8217;s historical experience. It is reasonably possible that additional warranty and other related claims could arise from disputes or other matters in excess of amounts accrued&#59; however, the Company does not expect that any such amounts, while not determinable, would have a material effect on the Company&#8217;s consolidated financial condition, results of operations or cash flows.</p><ix:continuation id="F_000302_cnt_2">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Changes in the Company&#8217;s assurance-type warranty liability were as follows (in millions):</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p></ix:continuation>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Due to the adoption of ASC 606, the Company determined that certain warranties previously classified as assurance-type warranties are service-type warranties. The liabilities associated with service-type warranties are disclosed in Note&#160;3 of the Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements.</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><br /></p></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">19</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" />
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:9pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><a href="#FOR_QUARTER_ENDED_MARCH_31_2019"><span style="text-decoration:underline;">Table of Contents</span></a></p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">OSHKOSH CORPORATION</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">NOTES TO CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">(Unaudited)</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000292" name="us-gaap:GuaranteesTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191001_20191231" escape="true">
<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">1</span><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">5</span><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">.</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:bold;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Calibri;font-size:10pt;">Guarantee Arrangements</p></td></tr></table></div>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Customers of the Company, from time to time, may fund purchases of the Company&#8217;s equipment through third-party finance companies. In certain instances, the Company may be requested to provide support for these arrangements through credit or residual value guarantees, by which the Company agrees to make payments to the finance companies in certain circumstances as further described below.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Credit Guarantees:<span style="font-style:normal;"> The Company is party to multiple agreements whereby at December 31, 2019 the Company guaranteed an aggregate of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000765" name="osk:GuaranteeObligationsAggregateIndebtednessOfOthers" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapGuaranteeObligationsByNatureAxis_oskIndirectGuaranteeOfDeferredPaymentAndLeasePaymentAgreementsMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">740.6</ix:nonFraction> million in indebtedness of customers. The Company estimated that its maximum loss exposure under these contracts at December 31, 2019 was $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000766" name="us-gaap:GuaranteeObligationsMaximumExposure" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapGuaranteeObligationsByNatureAxis_oskIndirectGuaranteeOfDeferredPaymentAndLeasePaymentAgreementsMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">144.0</ix:nonFraction> million. Terms of these guarantees coincide with the financing arranged by the customer and generally do not exceed five years. Under the terms of these agreements and upon the occurrence of certain events, the Company generally has the ability to, among other things, take possession of the underlying collateral. If the financial condition of the customers were to deteriorate and result in their inability to make payments, then loss provisions in excess of amounts provided for at inception may be required. Given the Company&#8217;s position as original equipment manufacturer and its knowledge of end markets, the Company, when called upon to fulfill a guarantee, generally has been able to liquidate the financed equipment at a minimal loss, if any, to the Company. While the Company does not expect to experience losses under these agreements that are materially in excess of the amounts reserved, it cannot provide any assurance that the financial condition of the third parties will not deteriorate resulting in the third parties&#8217; inability to meet their obligations. In the event that this occurs, the Company cannot guarantee that the collateral underlying the agreements will be sufficient to avoid losses materially in excess of the amounts reserved. Any losses under these guarantees would generally be mitigated by the value of any underlying collateral, including financed equipment. During periods of economic weakness, collateral values generally decline and can contribute to higher exposure to losses.</span></p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Residual Value Guarantees:<span style="font-style:normal;"> The Company is party to multiple agreements whereby at December 31, 2019 the Company guaranteed to support an aggregate of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000767" name="osk:EquipmentValueSoldIncludingResidualValueGuarantee" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapGuaranteeObligationsByNatureAxis_oskResidualValueGuaranteeMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">91.9</ix:nonFraction> million of customer equipment value. The Company estimated that its maximum loss exposure under these contracts at December 31, 2019 was $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000768" name="us-gaap:GuaranteeObligationsMaximumExposure" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapGuaranteeObligationsByNatureAxis_oskResidualValueGuaranteeMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">11.4</ix:nonFraction> million. Terms of these guarantees coincide with the financing arranged by the customer and generally do not exceed five years. Under the terms of these agreements, the Company guarantees that a piece of equipment will have a minimum residual value at a future date. If the counterparty is not able to recover the agreed upon residual value through sale, or alternative disposition, the Company is responsible for a portion of the shortfall. The Company is generally able to mitigate a portion of the risk associated with these guarantees by staggering the maturity terms of the guarantees, diversification of the portfolio and leveraging knowledge gained through the Company&#8217;s own experience in the used equipment markets. There can be no assurance the Company&#8217;s historical experience in used equipment markets will be indicative of future results. The Company&#8217;s ability to recover losses experienced from its guarantees may be affected by economic conditions in used equipment markets at the time of loss. During periods of economic weakness, residual values generally decline and can contribute to higher exposure to losses.</span></p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000322" name="osk:ScheduleOfProvisionForLossesOnCustomerGuaranteesTableTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191001_20191231" escape="true">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Changes in the Company&#8217;s guarantee liabilities were as follows (in millions):</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:9pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><a href="#FOR_QUARTER_ENDED_MARCH_31_2019"><span style="text-decoration:underline;">Table of Contents</span></a></p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">OSHKOSH CORPORATION</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">NOTES TO CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">(Unaudited)</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000293" name="us-gaap:CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191001_20191231" escape="true">
<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">1</span><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">6</span><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">.</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:bold;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Calibri;font-size:10pt;">Contingencies, Significant Estimates and Concentrations</p></td></tr></table></div>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Personal Injury Actions and Other<span style="font-style:normal;"> - Product and general liability claims are made against the Company from time to time in the ordinary course of business. The Company is generally self-insured for future claims up to $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000779" name="osk:LossContingencyMaximumSelfInsuranceCoveragePerClaim" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapLossContingenciesByNatureOfContingencyAxis_oskPersonalInjuryActionsAndOtherMember_20191001_20191231" decimals="INF" scale="6">5.0</ix:nonFraction>&#160;&#160;million per claim. Accordingly, a reserve is maintained for the estimated costs of such claims. At December 31, 2019 and September&#160;30,&#160;2019, the estimated net liabilities for product and general liability claims totaled $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000780" name="us-gaap:LossContingencyAccrualAtCarryingValue" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapLossContingenciesByNatureOfContingencyAxis_oskPersonalInjuryActionsAndOtherMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">34.6</ix:nonFraction> million and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000781" name="us-gaap:LossContingencyAccrualAtCarryingValue" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapLossContingenciesByNatureOfContingencyAxis_oskPersonalInjuryActionsAndOtherMember_20190930" decimals="-5" scale="6">36.2</ix:nonFraction> million, respectively. There is inherent uncertainty as to the eventual resolution of unsettled claims. Management, however, believes that any losses in excess of established reserves will not have a material effect on the Company&#8217;s financial condition, results of operations or cash flows.</span></p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Market Risks<span style="font-style:normal;"> - The Company was contingently liable under bid, performance and specialty bonds totaling $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000782" name="us-gaap:LossContingencyEstimateOfPossibleLoss" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapLossContingenciesByNatureOfContingencyAxis_oskPerformanceAndSpecialtyBondsMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">631.7</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000783" name="us-gaap:LossContingencyEstimateOfPossibleLoss" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapLossContingenciesByNatureOfContingencyAxis_oskPerformanceAndSpecialtyBondsMember_20190930" decimals="-5" scale="6">552.2</ix:nonFraction> million at December 31, 2019 and September&#160;30, 2019, respectively. Open standby letters of credit issued by the Company&#8217;s banks in favor of third parties totaled $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000784" name="us-gaap:LossContingencyEstimateOfPossibleLoss" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapLossContingenciesByNatureOfContingencyAxis_us-gaapStandbyLettersOfCreditMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">63.5</ix:nonFraction> million and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000785" name="us-gaap:LossContingencyEstimateOfPossibleLoss" contextRef="C_0000775158_us-gaapLossContingenciesByNatureOfContingencyAxis_us-gaapStandbyLettersOfCreditMember_20190930" decimals="-5" scale="6">63.7</ix:nonFraction> million at December&#160;31,&#160;2019 and September&#160;30,&#160;2019, respectively.</span></p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Other Matters<span style="font-style:normal;"> - The Company is subject to environmental matters and legal proceedings and claims, including patent, antitrust, product liability, warranty and state dealership regulation compliance proceedings, that arise in the ordinary course of business. Although the final results of all such matters and claims cannot be predicted with certainty, management believes that the ultimate resolution of all such matters and claims will not have a material effect on the Company&#8217;s financial condition, results of operations or cash flows. Actual results could vary, among other things, due to the uncertainties involved in litigation.</span></p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Major contracts for military systems are performed over extended periods of time and are subject to changes in scope of work and delivery schedules. Pricing negotiations on changes and settlement of claims often extend over prolonged periods of time. The Company&#8217;s ultimate profitability on such contracts may depend on the eventual outcome of an equitable settlement of contractual issues with the Company&#8217;s customers.</p></ix:nonNumeric><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000294" name="us-gaap:StockholdersEquityNoteDisclosureTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191001_20191231" escape="true">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:3.33%;text-indent:-3.33%;font-weight:bold;;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>
<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">1</span><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">7</span><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">.</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:bold;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Calibri;font-size:10pt;">Shareholders<span style="font-weight:normal;">&#8217; </span>Equity</p></td></tr></table></div>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">In August 2015, the Company&#8217;s Board of Directors approved a stock repurchase authorization for which there was as of May&#160;7,&#160;2019 a remaining authority to repurchase <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlishares" id="F_000788" name="us-gaap:StockRepurchaseProgramRemainingNumberOfSharesAuthorizedToBeRepurchased" contextRef="C_0000775158_20190507" decimals="INF" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">1,362,821</ix:nonFraction>&#160;shares of Common Stock. On May&#160;7,&#160;2019, the Company&#8217;s Board of Directors increased the Company&#8217;s Common Stock repurchase authorization by <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlishares" id="F_000787" name="osk:StockRepurchaseProgramNumberOfAdditionalSharesAuthorizedToBeRepurchased" contextRef="C_0000775158_20190507" decimals="INF" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">8,637,179</ix:nonFraction>&#160;shares to <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlishares" id="F_000786" name="us-gaap:StockRepurchaseProgramNumberOfSharesAuthorizedToBeRepurchased" contextRef="C_0000775158_20190507" decimals="INF" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">10,000,000</ix:nonFraction>&#160;shares as of that date. The Company repurchased <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlishares" id="F_000790" name="us-gaap:TreasuryStockSharesAcquired" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191001_20191231" decimals="INF" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">128,869</ix:nonFraction>&#160;shares of its Common Stock under this authorization during the three months ended December 31, 2019 at a cost of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000793" name="us-gaap:TreasuryStockValueAcquiredCostMethod" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191001_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">9.4</ix:nonFraction> million. The Company repurchased&#160;<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlishares" id="F_000791" name="us-gaap:TreasuryStockSharesAcquired" contextRef="C_0000775158_20181001_20181231" decimals="INF" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">2,563,087</ix:nonFraction> shares of Common Stock under this authorization during the three months ended December 31, 2018 at a cost of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000794" name="us-gaap:TreasuryStockValueAcquiredCostMethod" contextRef="C_0000775158_20181001_20181231" decimals="-5" scale="6">170.0</ix:nonFraction> million. As of December&#160;31,&#160;2019, the Company had repurchased <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlishares" id="F_000792" name="us-gaap:TreasuryStockSharesAcquired" contextRef="C_0000775158_20190507_20191231" decimals="INF" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">2,118,688</ix:nonFraction>&#160;shares under this authorization, resulting in remaining authority to repurchase <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlishares" id="F_000789" name="us-gaap:StockRepurchaseProgramRemainingNumberOfSharesAuthorizedToBeRepurchased" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191231" decimals="INF" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">7,881,312</ix:nonFraction>&#160;shares of Common Stock. The Company is restricted by its Credit Agreement from repurchasing shares in certain situations. See Note&#160;13 of the Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements for information regarding these restrictions.</p></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">21</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" />

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:1pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><br /></p></ix:nonNumeric></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">22</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" />
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:9pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><a href="#FOR_QUARTER_ENDED_MARCH_31_2019"><span style="text-decoration:underline;">Table of Contents</span></a></p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">OSHKOSH CORPORATION</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">NOTES TO CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">(Unaudited)</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000296" name="us-gaap:FairValueDisclosuresTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191001_20191231" escape="true">
<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">1</span><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">9</span><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">.</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:bold;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Calibri;font-size:10pt;">Fair Value Measurement</p></td></tr></table></div>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">FASB ASC Topic&#160;820, <span style="font-style:italic;">Fair Value Measurements and Disclosures</span>, defines fair value as the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability (i.e., exit price) in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date. FASB ASC Topic&#160;820 requires disclosures that categorize assets and liabilities measured at fair value into one of three different levels depending on the assumptions (i.e., inputs) used in the valuation. Level 1 provides the most reliable measure of fair value, while Level 3 generally requires significant management judgment.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The three levels are defined as follows:</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;text-indent:16.85%;">&#160;</p>
<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Calibri;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="top" style="width:10%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Level 1:</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Calibri;font-size:10pt;">Unadjusted quoted prices in active markets for identical assets or liabilities.</p></td></tr></table></div>
<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Calibri;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="top" style="width:10%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Level 2:</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Calibri;font-size:10pt;">Observable inputs other than quoted prices in active markets for identical assets or liabilities, such as quoted prices for similar assets or liabilities in active markets or quoted prices for identical assets or liabilities in inactive markets.</p></td></tr></table></div>
<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Calibri;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="top" style="width:10%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Level 3:</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Calibri;font-size:10pt;">Unobservable inputs reflecting management&#8217;s own assumptions about the inputs used in pricing the asset or liability.</p></td></tr></table></div>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">There were no transfers of assets between levels during the three months ended December 31, 2019.</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000325" name="us-gaap:ScheduleOfFairValueAssetsAndLiabilitiesMeasuredOnRecurringBasisTableTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191001_20191231" escape="true">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The fair values of the Company&#8217;s financial assets and liabilities were as follows (in millions):</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>

<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:2pt;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">(a)</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:2pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Calibri;font-size:10pt;"><ix:footnote id="FNT_000000" xml:lang="en-US">Represents investments in a rabbi trust for the Company&#8217;s non-qualified supplemental executive retirement plan (SERP). The fair values of these investments are determined using a market approach. Investments include mutual funds for which quoted prices in active markets are available. The Company records changes in the fair value of investments in &#8220;Miscellaneous, net&#8221; in the Condensed Consolidated Statements of Income.</ix:footnote></p></td></tr></table></div>

<td valign="top">

<hr style="page-break-after:always" />
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:9pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><a href="#FOR_QUARTER_ENDED_MARCH_31_2019"><span style="text-decoration:underline;">Table of Contents</span></a></p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">OSHKOSH CORPORATION</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">NOTES TO CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">(Unaudited)</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000297" name="us-gaap:SegmentReportingDisclosureTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191001_20191231" escape="true" continuedAt="F_000297_dcnt_ecaca8dd-3df9-4048-b7fd-af8cd3b982a8">
<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">20</span><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">.</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:bold;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Calibri;font-size:10pt;">Business Segment Information</p></td></tr></table></div>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company is organized into <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_oskSegment" id="F_000850" name="us-gaap:NumberOfReportableSegments" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191001_20191231" decimals="INF" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen">four</ix:nonFraction> reportable segments based on the internal organization used by the President and Chief Executive Officer for making operating decisions and measuring performance and based on the similarity of customers served, common management, common use of facilities and economic results attained.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">In accordance with FASB ASC Topic&#160;280, <span style="font-style:italic;">Segment Reporting</span>, for purposes of business segment performance measurement, the Company does not allocate to individual business segments costs or items that are of a non-operating nature or organizational or functional expenses of a corporate nature. The caption &#8220;Corporate&#8221; includes corporate office expenses, stock-based compensation, costs of certain business initiatives and shared services or operations benefiting multiple segments, and results of insignificant operations. Identifiable assets of the business segments exclude general corporate assets, which principally consist of cash and cash equivalents, certain property, plant and equipment, and certain other assets pertaining to corporate activities. Intersegment sales generally include amounts invoiced by a segment for work performed for another segment. Amounts are based on actual work performed and agreed-upon pricing, which is intended to be reflective of the contribution made by the supplying business segment.</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000326" name="us-gaap:ReconciliationOfRevenueFromSegmentsToConsolidatedTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000775158_20191001_20191231" escape="true">
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:3.33%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Calibri;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Selected financial information concerning the Company&#8217;s reportable segments and product lines is as follows (in millions):</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Calibri;font-size:11pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p>

<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#CFF0FC;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:8.1%; border-top:solid 0.75pt #000000; border-bottom:double 2.5pt #000000;white-space:nowrap;">
